destiny.core

Class PButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • destiny.core.PButton

  • public class PButton
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a button that can be added to a PApplet. It requires the EventHandler in order for its events to be triggered
    Version:
    12/5/2020
    Author:
    Nathaniel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PButton()
      Creates a button that can't be clicked on and is not visible
      PButton(java.awt.Shape collider, boolean onClick)
      Creates a button with the specified area.
      PButton(java.awt.Shape collider, processing.core.PImage texture, boolean onClick)
      Constructs a button with the specified area and image.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(java.lang.Runnable code)
      Sets a block of code to be run on the event the button is clicked
      boolean click(destiny.core.Event e)
      Called on the event of a click anywhere on the screen.
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet window)
      Draws the button to the window if it is visible (if it has an image)
      void listenOnClick(boolean onClick)
      Sets the button to either listen on click or on release
      boolean release(destiny.core.Event e)
      Called on the event of a mouse being released anywhere on the screen.
      void removeListener()
      Removes the runnable code from the button and doesn't allow the button to be triggered
      void removeTexture()
      Removes the image texture from the button
      void setTexture(processing.core.PImage texture)
      Sets the image for the button

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PButton

        public PButton(java.awt.Shape collider,
               boolean onClick)
        Creates a button with the specified area. Can also be set to trigger on click or on release
        Parameters:
        collider - The bounding box that the button should be triggered on
        onClick - Whether or not the button should trigger on click or on release

      • PButton

        public PButton(java.awt.Shape collider,
               processing.core.PImage texture,
               boolean onClick)
        Constructs a button with the specified area and image. Can also be set to trigger on click or on release
        Parameters:
        collider - The bounding box that the button should be triggered on
        texture - The Image texture that should be drawn for the button
        onClick - Whether or not the button should trigger on click or on release

      • PButton

        public PButton()
        Creates a button that can't be clicked on and is not visible

    • Method Detail

      • click

        public boolean click(destiny.core.Event e)
        Called on the event of a click anywhere on the screen. Information about the click will be passed as an Event
        Parameters:
        e - Information about the click that took place
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was actually being clicked on or if it was a click that took place outside the clickable

      • release

        public boolean release(destiny.core.Event e)
        Called on the event of a mouse being released anywhere on the screen. Information about the release will be passed as an Event
        Parameters:
        e - Information about the click that took place
        Returns:
        Whether or not the cursor was over the object on release and was clicking on the object to begin with

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet window)
        Draws the button to the window if it is visible (if it has an image)
        Parameters:
        window - The PApplet the button should be drawn to
        Postcondition:
        The PApplet will have the button drawn to it if the button is visible

      • addListener

        public void addListener(java.lang.Runnable code)
        Sets a block of code to be run on the event the button is clicked
        Parameters:
        code - The code that should be run in the event the button is clicked

      • listenOnClick

        public void listenOnClick(boolean onClick)
        Sets the button to either listen on click or on release
        Parameters:
        onClick - If true the button will be triggered on click, if false it will be triggered on release

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(processing.core.PImage texture)
        Sets the image for the button
        Parameters:
        texture - The Image that the button should be drawn with

      • removeTexture

        public void removeTexture()
        Removes the image texture from the button

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener()
        Removes the runnable code from the button and doesn't allow the button to be triggered
